intro: Tradescantia heterophylla, commonly known as the wandering jew, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, vibrant leaves that can range from deep green to shades of red and purple. The plant typically grows in a trailing or upright manner, depending on the environmental conditions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually pink or white, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of light conditions. Tradescantia heterophylla is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
